item.title: Complaint, 4th July
item.description:
Please see original complaint:494837 for reference prior to below. Further to my complaint dated 5th February 2025, I must express my deep disappointment regarding the way this matter has been handled. It is wholly unacceptable that it has taken over five months for Bromley Council to take action in response to an issue we raised immediately after the incident. My husband continues to suffer significant discomfort and mobility issues as a result of the serious shoulder injury he sustained due to the dangerous condition of the pavement on Eden Way. At the time, both my daughter and I contacted you to report this incident and make you aware of the severe impact it had on our family. Despite this, the matter was initially dismissed, seemingly on the grounds that multiple complaints had not been made—an incredibly frustrating and insensitive response given the circumstances. We experienced, firsthand, the distress and complications that followed—emergency treatment, surgery, and prolonged recovery, all stemming from a hazard that could and should have been addressed promptly. It is only now, five months later, that the council has chosen to acknowledge the issue and accept responsibility. This delay is not only unacceptable but has also compounded the suffering endured by my husband and our family. I would appreciate a formal response outlining the steps Bromley Council intends to take both to resolve this matter and to ensure similar failures do not occur in future.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Way, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice Cream Trucks Causing Dangerous Situation on Westminster Bridge, 4th July
item.description:
Ice cream trucks are regularly parking along Westminster Bridge, drawing large numbers of pedestrians into the cycle lane to queue or purchase items. This creates a serious safety hazard: pedestrians are often unaware they’re standing in the path of fast-moving cyclists, increasing the risk of serious injury or even death. This is a high-traffic area for both foot and cycle travel, and the current situation is extremely dangerous. These vendors should be regularly ticketed by the police and/or forced to move along, as their presence is illegal and poses a clear public safety risk. Please investigate enforcement of parking and trading restrictions, and consider permanent measures to prevent vendors from operating in this location if they continue to endanger the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westminster Bridge Road, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin collection keeps being missed, 4th July
item.description:
The bins on kingsland road for household waste keep getting missed. Recycling is taken weekly whilst household waste has become irregular - its now about once a month in the last two months. The bins are overflowing regularly

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Traffic light facing the wrong way, 4th July
item.description:
The traffic light on Footscray Road, on the centre crossing between Chattertons Estate Agents and Pop Street, should be facing oncoming traffic from the station side of Footscray Road, but it has been turned around to face completely the wrong direction.

item.title: Unique Style Flyposters on all exits of roundabout, 4th July
item.description:
Please check carefully as there are 4 of these advertising boards on this junction. Bromley Road Junction of Camden Park Road, Chislehurst. Please will you fine this company for littering our streets with their advertising junk. What3Words of the locations ///doors.angle.films ///shop.shiny.than ///wings.notes.hike

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Hill, Chislehurst, London
